programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the Premier League. Here, Wolves welcome reigning champions Man City to Molineux for a thrilling tussle in the 2019-20 campaign.

programme.desc: This week, Pape Matar Sarr discusses his early links to Barcelona, before moving to Metz and then Tottenham Hotspur. Plus, he highlights his passions for computer science and Formula 1.

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Two teams uncharacteristically languishing in the bottom half of the table face off on Super Sunday, as Spurs host Manchester United at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. (16.02)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: On Super Sunday, Molineux is Newcastle's destination for a Premier League assignment away at Wolves. Eddie Howe's Magpies are unbeaten with seven points to their name so far. (15.09)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: A three-game winning run brought to a halt at Craven Cottage sees Arsenal go for all three points here, as a refreshed Everton pay a Premier League visit to the Emirates Stadium. (14.12)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: A week on from their 2-2 draw away in Manchester, Arsenal return to the Emirates as they host a Leicester side still searching for their first Premier League win of the season. (28.09)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25
programme.desc: Without a Premier League win in four attempts, Mikel Arteta's Arsenal target a return to winning ways against a Nottingham Forest side level on 19 points with the Gunners. (23.11)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.desc: A Premier League clash at Villa Park with both teams coming from defeat, as European hopefuls Aston Villa and relegation-threatened Ipswich target a return to winning ways. (15.02)

programme.title: Premier League Highlights 24/25

programme.desc: A chance to relive some classic action from the EFL. Here, Wolverhampton Wanderers host Leeds United at Molineux in April 2015 in a thrilling game that saw seven goals.

programme.desc: Relive a classic match from the English Football League. Here, Swindon Town host Sheffield United at the County Ground in a 10-goal thriller in the play-offs back in May 2015.

programme.title: EFL Cup 14/15: Chelsea v Tottenham
programme.desc: A look back at some famous matches from yesteryear. Here, Chelsea face Tottenham Hotspur in the final of the Capital One Cup at Wembley Stadium in 2015.

programme.title: SPFL: There's Only One Sauzee
programme.desc: Hibernian legend Franck Sauzée sits down with Luke Shanley to reflect on his time in Leith as a Hibs player and manager, and recollect his Champions League success with Marseille in 1993.

programme.title: SPFL: Dundee United - Champions 83
programme.desc: This is the story of Dundee United's 1982-83 title triumph under the revolutionary management of Jim McLean. With interviews from club legends including Paul Hegarty and Maurice Malpas.

programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the Championship. Here the play-off final from the 2011-12 campaign, as Blackpool and West Ham meet at Wembley.

programme.desc: Relive some classic action from the English Football League. Here, East Anglian rivals Norwich City and Ipswich Town meet at Carrow Road in the Sky Bet play-offs in May 2015.

programme.title: EFL 14/15: Derby County v Leeds
programme.desc: A chance to relive some classic action from the EFL. Here, Derby County take on Leeds United at Pride Park in August 2015 in a game that saw a thrilling late winner.

programme.title: EFL 15/16: Hull City v Reading
programme.desc: A chance to relive some classic action from the EFL. Here, Hull City take on Reading at the KC Stadium in December 2015 in a thrilling clash that saw a late winner.

programme.title: EFL 15/16: QPR v Middlesbrough
programme.desc: A chance to relive some classic action from the English Football League. Here, QPR host Middlesbrough in a five-goal thriller at Loftus Road in the 2015-16 season.

programme.title: EFL 15/16: B'ham v Middlesbrough
programme.desc: Relive some classic action from the English Football League. Here, Birmingham City take on Middlesbrough at St Andrew's in a four-goal thriller in the 2015-16 season.

programme.title: EFL 15/16:Middlesbrough v Brighton
programme.desc: A look back at some classic matches from the English Football League. Here, Middlesbrough take on Brighton and Hove Albion in a tense Championship promotion decider in May 2016.

programme.title: EFL 16/17: Aston Villa v N. Forest
programme.desc: A look back at some classic matches from the English Football League. Here, Aston Villa play Nottingham Forest in a thrilling draw in September 2016 in the Sky Bet Championship.

programme.title: EFL Cup 15/16:Liverpool v Man City
programme.desc: The first silverware of the season is claimed as Liverpool meet Manchester City at Wembley in the Capital One Cup final. Both have won this recently, Liverpool in 2012 and Man City in 2014.

programme.title: 1983 - When Aberdeen Ruled Europe
programme.desc: The story of the greatest year in the history of Aberdeen, when the yet to be knighted, Alex Ferguson, guided the club to two European trophies in the space of six months.

programme.title: Jack Draper's US Open
programme.desc: Revisit the story of Jack Draper's breakthrough tournament at the 2024 US Open, as the rising British star went all the way to the men's singles semi-finals at the New York Grand Slam.

programme.title: US Open '24 Men's Final
programme.desc: A look at the 2024 US Open men's singles final, as the home hope Taylor Fritz attempted to end a 21-year wait for an American man to win a Grand Slam title against Jannik Sinner of Italy.

programme.title: US Open '24 Women's Final
programme.desc: A look at the 2024 US Open women's singles final, when New York's own Jessica Pegula entered her first Grand Slam final against Aryna Sabalenka as a first-time winner was crowned on Ashe.

programme.title: Connors v Borg 1976

programme.title: Serena v Azarenka 2012
programme.desc: After three sets of gruelling competition in the 2012 final of the women's singles, Serena Williams defeated Victoria Azarenka in the first of two back-to-back finals at the US Open.

programme.title: Raducanu v Fernandez 2021
programme.desc: Going 10 rounds without dropping a set, Great Britain's Emma Raducanu claimed the women's title at the 2021 US Open, becoming the first-ever qualifier to win a singles Grand Slam.

programme.desc: A look at Bjorn Borg's swansong, as the Swede came up against long-standing rival John McEnroe in the 1981 US Open men's singles final.

programme.title: Alcaraz v Ruud 2022

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Lady Luck. The baggage battlers head to an esteemed estate sale in St. Paul, where they bid on items ranging from automotive parts and a rare doll to a hockey mascot costume. S3, Ep3

programme.desc: California Scheming. The Baggage Battlers wage war at the crazy, eclectic Santa Cruz Lost Property Auction, where Mark brings in reinforcements to battle Billy over antique toys. S2, Ep9

programme.title: Baggage Battles

programme.title: Baggage Battles

programme.title: Baggage Battles

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Liar Liar. The Baggage Battlers attend a well-kept secret sheriff's auction in Shreveport, LA. Billy scores a touchdown with his winnings, while a local sheriff interrogates Mark. S2, Ep13

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Shock & Awe. The Baggage Battlers heads to the Louisiana Farm auction to bid on Americana collected for over 50 years. Mark misfires when he bids on the wrong item. S2, Ep14

programme.title: Baggage Battles

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Two For The Road. Andy calls in help to get his 1932 Roadster up and running. Another project faces problems - combining parts from two Chevy trucks into a single 'FrankenTruck.' S3, Ep10

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Crushing Cars And Taking Names. Andy's yard sees some unusual additions. There's an iconic piece of military history, and a dinosaur-sized bulldozer that no one knows what to do with. S3, Ep11

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: A Pack Rat, A Rat Rod, And A Bug. Andy finds a 1931 Model A looking like it just drove out of a movie about the Mob, and a 1963 VW Bug that needs some love. S3, Ep12

programme.desc: The Future Is Now. A '32 roadster bought for a client's wife is secretly shipped to Kindig It for upgrades and styling changes. A 2004 Hummer arrives for a futuristic redesign! S4, Ep14

programme.desc: The Secret Client. Dave is tasked with finding and transforming a 1967 GTO for a secret client from South Africa. Meanwhile, Dave buys back one of his first builds, a Karman Ghia. S4, Ep15

programme.desc: Bad Chad To The Bone. Chad is tasked with his first-ever motorcycle build. With the Wharf Rat Bike Rally just weeks away, can he beat the clock to finish this one-of-a-kind chopper? S1, Ep10

programme.desc: It Knows We're Here. Mireya's darkest nightmare comes true. Meanwhile, Russell investigates a possible Bigfoot underwater passageway. S1, Ep7

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Me, Myself and AI: Animated adventure series. The gang have to solve a computerised mystery when an artificial intelligence takes over the building of a trendy tech company.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: The Sword, The Fox, and the Scooby Doo!: Driving in Japan, the Mystery Inc. gang are stopped by famous actor Mark Hamill, who's in town for a high school reunion.

programme.title: Dinner Date

programme.desc: Follow TOWIE's favourite couple Georgia and Tommy on their journey into parenthood. Georgia and Tommy prepare for their baby's arrival.

programme.desc: True-life soap. Lauren G and Sam react to a kiss, Mark gives Arg a makeover, Lucy realises that time is running out for her and Mario, and Chloe celebrates her 30th birthday.

programme.desc: D**** and D****n't: US reality series. A startling discovery is made during a scavenger hunt while in Palm Beach, and Kiki erupts after Lisa talks about Lenny one too many times.

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City
programme.desc: Apres Rumour: US reality series. The rumour about Angie's marriage has a ripple effect on the group, and Meredith finds comfort in her family after a trauma.

programme.desc: Chris: Personal trainer Chris is going to be given five menus, each of which has been put together by a potential blind date - who will he want to see for a date and maybe seconds?

programme.desc: Follow TOWIE's favourite couple Georgia and Tommy on their journey into parenthood. Georgia and Tommy adapt to life as parents.

programme.desc: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes: Reality series. Tracy and Heather aim to prove that two blondes are better than one when they score more than they bargained for with a Beverly Hills home.

programme.desc: Palm Beach Pandemonium: US reality series. The ladies play croquet in Palm Beach, Nicole's family expands unexpectedly, and Lenny files a motion citing Lisa as an unfit mother.

programme.desc: An Olive Branch with Thorns: US reality series. Angie tries to get clarification about the rumours, but things go awry when Monica's mum intervenes at a party.

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: Noel and Liz Edmonds' River Haven business in Ngatimoti is still struggling, so the TV veteran and his team plan a huge celebration for car lovers to turn things around. Noel also hopes a VIP will agree to meet him for lunch, navigates problems with giant boulders in his energy garden, and has a romantic proposal for Liz

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage eight, a flat 171.4km route from Saint-Méen-le-Grand to Laval Espace Mayenne. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the low-cost staple that is rice, starting with crispy rice with two deliciously moreish toppings that are great for entertaining too.They follow this up with Thai mango sticky rice, a Thai beef salad with a roasted rice dressing, and crispy Persian rice with spiced chicken

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure, featuring the voices of Will Smith, Jack Black, Renée Zellweger and Robert De Niro. Little fish Oscar yearns for a life of celebrity, so he collaborates with a vegetarian great white to dupe fellow fish into believing he's a heroic shark killer.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actress Penelope Keith, actor Robert Lindsay and musical theatre star Marisha Wallace join Alan at Manor Farm. Plus, horticulturalist Camilla Bassett Smith brings colour to autumn borders, and the Love Your Weekend greenhouse makes its debut

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Preston v Liverpool Friendly
programme.desc: Preston North End v Liverpool (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the friendly at Deepdale. Preston finished 20th in the Championship last term and will look forward to testing themselves against the reigning Premier League champions, who have further strengthened their squad over the summer by signing the likes of full-backs Milos Kerkez and Jeremie Frimpong and attacking midfielder Florian Wirtz

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: STV weather presenter Sean Batty explores more of the best places Scotland has to offer, beginning by travelling to the East Neuk of Fife. There he makes cheese, visits a secret bunker, has a dip in the Pittenweem tidal pool and learns about the wildlife and history of the Isle of May

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland takes a look back at the Ravenscraig steel plant in Motherwell and Jennifer Reoch learns about Edna Nellis, a pioneer of Scottish women's football

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Wales (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' third and final Group D match, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. England got their defence of the trophy off to a disappointing start with a 2-1 defeat at the hands of France, but then bounced back in style with a 4-0 win over the Netherlands. Wales are playing in their first Euros and have succumbed to three-goal defeats in each of their first two contests. The sides have not met since two FIFA World Cup qualifiers in 2018, when Wales earned a surprising goalless draw in Southampton, before the Lionesses prevailed 3-0 in Newport. With analysis from Emma Hayes, Karen Carney and Jayne Ludlow, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic adventure thriller, starring Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw and Richard Dreyfuss. The Atlantic resort of Amity Island is preparing for its lucrative summer season when death strikes in the form of a Great White shark. Rather than turn away business, Mayor Vaughn orders police chief Brody to keep the beaches open.

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Snetterton featuring racing from The Vertu MINI CHALLENGE and the Porsche Carrera Cup Great Britain.

programme.title: Unwind with STV

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights

programme.title: How Jaws Changed the World
programme.desc: Now 50 years old, Steven Spielberg's Jaws casts a long shadow on both the film industry and the fate of many shark species, leading to widespread slaughter around the world due to the fear it provoked in people. However, the movie also inspired a whole generation of marine biologists to specialise in sharks and this documentary reveals that much more is known now about this misunderstood species than ever before

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sarah thinks all hope is lost, Charity makes an offer, and John feels terrible about the week ahead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations. Barnaby and Winter's investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win. Neil Dudgeon stars

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Sycamore Gap: Britain's Lost Landmark
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning of September 28, 2023, two best friends took a chainsaw to a remote spot in Northumberland and chopped down one of the nation's best-known and best-loved trees. Extraordinarily, they filmed themselves committing a crime that shocked the world. As Daniel Graham and Adam Carruthers are sentenced for the felling of the Sycamore Gap tree, Tom Barton tells the full story of what happened that night. He hears from people whose biggest life events involved the tree, those who were responsible for caring for it, and the police officer who cracked the case

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: Noel and Liz Edmonds' River Haven business in Ngatimoti is still struggling, so the TV veteran and his team plan a huge celebration for car lovers to turn things around. Noel also hopes a VIP will agree to meet him for lunch, navigates problems with giant boulders in his energy garden, and has a romantic proposal for Liz

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Gary Imlach presents a look back at the 10 stages of the prestigious race, as the riders enjoy the first rest day. With reports by Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: From the Ground Up
programme.desc: Can Ian Wright and coach Paul get their squad organised and Ten Em Bee FCÔÇÖs first-ever girlsÔÇÖ team into the league in time?

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: Noel and Liz Edmonds' River Haven business in Ngatimoti is still struggling, so the TV veteran and his team plan a huge celebration for car lovers to turn things around. Noel also hopes a VIP will agree to meet him for lunch, navigates problems with giant boulders in his energy garden, and has a romantic proposal for Liz

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage eight, a flat 171.4km route from Saint-Méen-le-Grand to Laval Espace Mayenne. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the low-cost staple that is rice, starting with crispy rice with two deliciously moreish toppings that are great for entertaining too.They follow this up with Thai mango sticky rice, a Thai beef salad with a roasted rice dressing, and crispy Persian rice with spiced chicken

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure, featuring the voices of Will Smith, Jack Black, Renée Zellweger and Robert De Niro. Little fish Oscar yearns for a life of celebrity, so he collaborates with a vegetarian great white to dupe fellow fish into believing he's a heroic shark killer.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actress Penelope Keith, actor Robert Lindsay and musical theatre star Marisha Wallace join Alan at Manor Farm. Plus, horticulturalist Camilla Bassett Smith brings colour to autumn borders, and the Love Your Weekend greenhouse makes its debut

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Preston v Liverpool Friendly
programme.desc: Preston North End v Liverpool (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the friendly at Deepdale. Preston finished 20th in the Championship last term and will look forward to testing themselves against the reigning Premier League champions, who have further strengthened their squad over the summer by signing the likes of full-backs Milos Kerkez and Jeremie Frimpong and attacking midfielder Florian Wirtz

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: STV weather presenter Sean Batty explores more of the best places Scotland has to offer, beginning by travelling to the East Neuk of Fife. There he makes cheese, visits a secret bunker, has a dip in the Pittenweem tidal pool and learns about the wildlife and history of the Isle of May

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland takes a look back at the Ravenscraig steel plant in Motherwell and Jennifer Reoch learns about Edna Nellis, a pioneer of Scottish women's football

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Wales (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' third and final Group D match, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. England got their defence of the trophy off to a disappointing start with a 2-1 defeat at the hands of France, but then bounced back in style with a 4-0 win over the Netherlands. Wales are playing in their first Euros and have succumbed to three-goal defeats in each of their first two contests. The sides have not met since two FIFA World Cup qualifiers in 2018, when Wales earned a surprising goalless draw in Southampton, before the Lionesses prevailed 3-0 in Newport. With analysis from Emma Hayes, Karen Carney and Jayne Ludlow, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic adventure thriller, starring Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw and Richard Dreyfuss. The Atlantic resort of Amity Island is preparing for its lucrative summer season when death strikes in the form of a Great White shark. Rather than turn away business, Mayor Vaughn orders police chief Brody to keep the beaches open.

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Snetterton featuring racing from The Vertu MINI CHALLENGE and the Porsche Carrera Cup Great Britain.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Sycamore Gap: Britain's Lost Landmark
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning of September 28, 2023, two best friends took a chainsaw to a remote spot in Northumberland and chopped down one of the nation's best-known and best-loved trees. Extraordinarily, they filmed themselves committing a crime that shocked the world. As Daniel Graham and Adam Carruthers are sentenced for the felling of the Sycamore Gap tree, Tom Barton tells the full story of what happened that night. He hears from people whose biggest life events involved the tree, those who were responsible for caring for it, and the police officer who cracked the case

programme.title: Noel Edmonds' Kiwi Adventure
programme.desc: Noel and Liz Edmonds' River Haven business in Ngatimoti is still struggling, so the TV veteran and his team plan a huge celebration for car lovers to turn things around. Noel also hopes a VIP will agree to meet him for lunch, navigates problems with giant boulders in his energy garden, and has a romantic proposal for Liz

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Gary Imlach presents a look back at the 10 stages of the prestigious race, as the riders enjoy the first rest day. With reports by Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: From the Ground Up
programme.desc: Can Ian Wright and coach Paul get their squad organised and Ten Em Bee FCÔÇÖs first-ever girlsÔÇÖ team into the league in time?

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage eight, a flat 171.4km route from Saint-Méen-le-Grand to Laval Espace Mayenne. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner celebrate the low-cost staple that is rice, starting with crispy rice with two deliciously moreish toppings that are great for entertaining too.They follow this up with Thai mango sticky rice, a Thai beef salad with a roasted rice dressing, and crispy Persian rice with spiced chicken

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure, featuring the voices of Will Smith, Jack Black, Renée Zellweger and Robert De Niro. Little fish Oscar yearns for a life of celebrity, so he collaborates with a vegetarian great white to dupe fellow fish into believing he's a heroic shark killer.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans to make a mini allotment, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and JJ Goodman serves up more delicious drinks

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actress Penelope Keith, actor Robert Lindsay and musical theatre star Marisha Wallace join Alan at Manor Farm. Plus, horticulturalist Camilla Bassett Smith brings colour to autumn borders, and the Love Your Weekend greenhouse makes its debut

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce and Michelle Yeoh. Intending to reap the profits of increased ratings for his global multimedia empire, Elliot Carver attempts to ignite a conflict between Britain and China by sinking a British frigate and shooting down a Chinese fighter plane. The British Secret Service sends James Bond to verify suspicions that Carver is behind the incident.

programme.title: Preston v Liverpool Friendly
programme.desc: Preston North End v Liverpool (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the friendly at Deepdale. Preston finished 20th in the Championship last term and will look forward to testing themselves against the reigning Premier League champions, who have further strengthened their squad over the summer by signing the likes of full-backs Milos Kerkez and Jeremie Frimpong and attacking midfielder Florian Wirtz

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Sean's Scotland
programme.desc: STV weather presenter Sean Batty explores more of the best places Scotland has to offer, beginning by travelling to the East Neuk of Fife. There he makes cheese, visits a secret bunker, has a dip in the Pittenweem tidal pool and learns about the wildlife and history of the Isle of May

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Fergus Sutherland takes a look back at the Ravenscraig steel plant in Motherwell and Jennifer Reoch learns about Edna Nellis, a pioneer of Scottish women's football

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Wales (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of both teams' third and final Group D match, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. England got their defence of the trophy off to a disappointing start with a 2-1 defeat at the hands of France, but then bounced back in style with a 4-0 win over the Netherlands. Wales are playing in their first Euros and have succumbed to three-goal defeats in each of their first two contests. The sides have not met since two FIFA World Cup qualifiers in 2018, when Wales earned a surprising goalless draw in Southampton, before the Lionesses prevailed 3-0 in Newport. With analysis from Emma Hayes, Karen Carney and Jayne Ludlow, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic adventure thriller, starring Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw and Richard Dreyfuss. The Atlantic resort of Amity Island is preparing for its lucrative summer season when death strikes in the form of a Great White shark. Rather than turn away business, Mayor Vaughn orders police chief Brody to keep the beaches open.

programme.title: My Family

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: A Night Out: More domestic hi-jinks with Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker. An eventful night out is had by all, as Janey and Susan go to a hen night, and Roger has a blind date.

programme.title: My Family

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Accusin' Susan: Laughs aplenty with sitcom stalwart Robert Lindsay. Kenzo seems to be the victim of a revenge campaign. Susan is embroiled in a sexual harassment case at work.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: The Exchange Student (Part 2): Hugh Dennis and Claire Skinner are put-upon parents in the brilliant sitcom. Mum must decide what to do about Jake's girlfriend. A new guest arrives.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: The Hamster / Rites of Passage: Award-winning family sitcom. Karen has trouble adapting to big school, Ben auditions for the school musical and Jake makes a foolish fashion choice.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: The Swimming Competition / K for Victory: Family-based sitcom. Karen indulges her competitive instincts, Ben explores human psychology and Jake appoints himself as a parenting expert.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: The Goddaughter / House of Hormones: More family frustrations with the Brockmans. The arrival of Dad's god-daughter from Australia has an unfortunate effect on the Brockman household.

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: The Gap Year / Into the Wilderness: More family frustrations with the Brockmans. Dad and Ben go on a camping trip, where Ben shows off his survival skills. Jake has to decide about a gap year.

programme.title: Outnumbered

programme.desc: Reality series following the paramedics of West Midlands Ambulance Service. Crews race to a serious motorway accident. A young woman is showing signs of sepsis.

programme.desc: Jonathan has a camera put inside his lungs to find out if he has cancer. James needs a knee operation so he can play with his children again, and a growth is removed from Jan's ear.

programme.desc: A girl has an operation to have squints in both eyes realigned, a man has his infected gall bladder removed and an ex-police officer is having a grommet inserted in her ear.
